intro: Lobelia lisowskii, commonly known as the Lisowski's lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests and mountain meadows. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes other familiar genera like Bellis and Lobelia. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
